Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the results of the "right to try" law by stating that there have been "incredible results already," when there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to back up the statement about the results of the "right to try" law.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence anyone has received access to unapproved medications under the "right to try" law.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by making false and unsupported claims about the "right to try" law.
Problematic assumption: There is no problematic assumption evident in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
